title: Plutonian
data:
A user has suggested the **deletion of this page**. Reason: Never included in Crawl, even trunk. Not under active development.

***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                                                                                                      |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | Radioactive humanoids that draw strength from their magical contamination. If they accumulate too much contamination, they meltdown. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Skill and Equipment](#Starting_Skill_and_Equipment)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill Aptitudes](#Skill_Aptitudes)
- [7 Strategy](#Strategy)

## Innate Abilities

- Nuclear powered: Plutonians do not suffer from [hunger](/Hunger "Hunger"), naturally suffer from [magical contamination](/Magical_contamination "Magical contamination"), by default hovering around grey or yellow contamination. This does not result in dangerous explosions or [bad mutations](/Bad_mutations "Bad mutations"), but does mean you are often [backlit](/Corona "Corona") and cannot go [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible").
- Overload: Plutonians can choose to release magical contamination at will, releasing a powerful burst of non-elemental damage to everything within two tiles of you (yourself included). Costs 2 [MP](/MP "MP").
- Meltdown: Once you reach red contamination or worse, you are at risk of having a meltdown. This occurs in place of the normal violent release of magical contamination, and is a massive non-elemental explosion which injures everything in your line of sight. This reduces your contamination to a safe yellow level once again, but also inflicts large amounts of [rot](/Rot "Rot"), semi-permanently reducing your max [HP](/HP "HP").

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter")
- **Zealots:** [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker"), [Abyssal Knight](/Abyssal_Knight "Abyssal Knight"), [Death Knight](/Death_Knight_\(background\) "Death Knight (background)")
- **Mages:** [Wizard](/Wizard "Wizard"), [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist"), [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist"), [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist"), [Venom Mage](/Venom_Mage "Venom Mage")

## Level Bonuses

?

## Starting Skill and Equipment

?

## Difficulty of Play

?

## Skill Aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

|               [Skill](/Skill "Skill")              | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |            [Skill](/Skill "Skill")           | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                    ***Attack***                    |                                  |              ***Miscellaneous***             |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|          [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")          |                 0                |          [Armour](/Armour "Armour")          |                                0 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                                0 |
|          [Short Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                 0                |         [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")        |                                0 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                               -1 |
|           [Long Blades](/Weapon "Weapon")          |                 0                |         [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth")        |                                0 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                               -1 |
|              [Axes](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                 0                |         [Shields](/Shields "Shields")        |                                0 | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                         |                               -1 |
|         [Maces & Flails](/Weapon "Weapon")         |                 0                |                                              |                                  | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                               -1 |
|            [Polearms](/Weapon "Weapon")            |                 0                |                                              |                                  | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                               -1 |
|      [Staves](/Magical_staff "Magical staff")      |                 0                |                                              |                                  | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                               -1 |
| [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") |                 0                |                                              |                                  | [Transmutation](/Transmutation "Transmutation")    |                                0 |
|                                                    |                                  |    [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")    |                                1 |                                                    |                                  |
|          [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")          |                 0                |      [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")     |                                1 | [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")          |                                1 |
|             [Slings](/Weapon "Weapon")             |                 0                |      [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")     |                                1 | [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")             |                                1 |
|              [Bows](/Weapon "Weapon")              |                 0                |   [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")  |                                1 |                                                    |                                  |
|            [Crossbows](/Weapon "Weapon")           |                 0                | [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic") |                                1 | [Experience](/Experience "Experience")             |                               -1 |

## Strategy

Points of interest:

- No hunger system, so feel free to spam [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk"), [Elyvilon](/Elyvilon "Elyvilon")'s pacification, and high level spells to your heart's content.
- No contamination threat: Don't worry too much about spell failure percentages. Also, no invisibility, poor stealth.
- Overload: A heavy nuke that self-harms, but blasts everything within 2 tiles. Excellent against high-EV or swarm threats in the early game, such as [killer bees](/Killer_bee "Killer bee").
- Slow leveling, no real skill focus: Play them however you see fit, but don't diversify too much or you'll be very underpowered.
html:
Plutonian

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search

A user has suggested the deletion of this page. Reason: Never included in Crawl, even trunk. Not under active development.

Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Radioactive humanoids that draw strength from their magical contamination. If they accumulate too much contamination, they meltdown.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Skill and Equipment
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill Aptitudes
  • 7 Strategy

Innate Abilities

  • Nuclear powered: Plutonians do not suffer from hunger, naturally suffer from magical contamination, by default hovering around grey or yellow contamination. This does not result in dangerous explosions or bad mutations, but does mean you are often backlit and cannot go invisible.
  • Overload: Plutonians can choose to release magical contamination at will, releasing a powerful burst of non-elemental damage to everything within two tiles of you (yourself included). Costs 2 MP.
  • Meltdown: Once you reach red contamination or worse, you are at risk of having a meltdown. This occurs in place of the normal violent release of magical contamination, and is a massive non-elemental explosion which injures everything in your line of sight. This reduces your contamination to a safe yellow level once again, but also inflicts large amounts of rot, semi-permanently reducing your max HP.

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Fighter
  • Zealots: Berserker, Abyssal Knight, Death Knight
  • Mages: Wizard, Fire Elementalist, Ice Elementalist, Air Elementalist, Earth Elementalist, Venom Mage

Level Bonuses

?

Starting Skill and Equipment

?

Difficulty of Play

?

Skill Aptitudes

The higher the value, the better the aptitude.

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 0 Armour 0 Spellcasting 0
Short Blades 0 Dodging 0 Conjurations -1
Long Blades 0 Stealth 0 Hexes -1
Axes 0 Shields 0 Charms -1
Maces & Flails 0 Summonings -1
Polearms 0 Necromancy -1
Staves 0 Translocations -1
Unarmed Combat 0 Transmutation 0
Fire Magic 1
Throwing 0 Ice Magic 1 Invocations 1
Slings 0 Air Magic 1 Evocations 1
Bows 0 Earth Magic 1
Crossbows 0 Poison Magic 1 Experience -1

Strategy

Points of interest:

  • No hunger system, so feel free to spam berserk, Elyvilon's pacification, and high level spells to your heart's content.
  • No contamination threat: Don't worry too much about spell failure percentages. Also, no invisibility, poor stealth.
  • Overload: A heavy nuke that self-harms, but blasts everything within 2 tiles. Excellent against high-EV or swarm threats in the early game, such as killer bees.
  • Slow leveling, no real skill focus: Play them however you see fit, but don't diversify too much or you'll be very underpowered.

{{delete|Never included in Crawl, even trunk. Not under active development.}} {{obsolete}}

{{flavour|Radioactive humanoids that draw strength from their magical contamination. If they accumulate too much contamination, they meltdown.}}

==Innate Abilities==
*Nuclear powered: Plutonians do not suffer from [[hunger]], naturally suffer from [[magical contamination]], by default hovering around grey or yellow contamination. This does not result in dangerous explosions or [[bad mutations]], but does mean you are often [[Corona|backlit]] and cannot go [[invisible]].
*Overload: Plutonians can choose to release magical contamination at will, releasing a powerful burst of non-elemental damage to everything within two tiles of you (yourself included). Costs 2 [[MP]].
*Meltdown: Once you reach red contamination or worse, you are at risk of having a meltdown. This occurs in place of the normal violent release of magical contamination, and is a massive non-elemental explosion which injures everything in your line of sight. This reduces your contamination to a safe yellow level once again, but also inflicts large amounts of [[rot]], semi-permanently reducing your max [[HP]].

==Preferred Backgrounds==
*'''Warriors:''' [[Fighter]]
*'''Zealots:''' [[Berserker]], [[Abyssal Knight]], [[Death Knight (background)|Death Knight]]
*'''Mages:''' [[Wizard]], [[Fire Elementalist]], [[Ice Elementalist]], [[Air Elementalist]], [[Earth Elementalist]], [[Venom Mage]]

==Strategy==
Points of interest:
*No hunger system, so feel free to spam [[berserk]], [[Elyvilon]]'s pacification, and high level spells to your heart's content.
*No contamination threat: Don't worry too much about spell failure percentages. Also, no invisibility, poor stealth.
*Overload: A heavy nuke that self-harms, but blasts everything within 2 tiles. Excellent against high-EV or swarm threats in the early game, such as [[killer bee]]s.
*Slow leveling, no real skill focus: Play them however you see fit, but don't diversify too much or you'll be very underpowered.
